1.name: Modern Times
1.description: The Tramp struggles to live in modern industrial society with the help of a young homeless woman.

2.name: Rose-Marie
2.description: An incognito opera singer falls for a policeman who has been assigned to track down her fugitive brother.

3.name: My Man Godfrey
3.description: A scatterbrained socialite hires a vagrant as a family butler - but there's more to Godfrey than meets the eye.

4.name: Sabotage
4.description: A Scotland Yard undercover detective is on the trail of a saboteur who is part of a plot to set off a bomb in London. But when the detective's cover is blown, the plot begins to unravel.

5.name: Things to Come
5.description: The story of a century: a decades-long second World War leaves plague and anarchy, then a rational state rebuilds civilization and attempts space travel.

6.name: Anthony Adverse
6.description: In 18th-century Italy, an orphan's debt to the man who raised him threatens to separate him forever from the woman he loves.

7.name: The Texas Rangers
7.description: Two down-on-their-luck former outlaws volunteer to be Texas Rangers and find themselves assigned to bring in an old friend, now a notorious outlaw.

8.name: Dracula's Daughter
8.description: Hungarian countess Marya Zaleska seeks the aid of a noted psychiatrist, hoping to free herself of a mysterious evil influence.

9.name: Flash Gordon
9.description: Flash Gordon, Dale Arden and Dr. Alexis Zarkov visit the planet Mongo to thwart the evil schemes of Emperor Ming the Merciless, who has set his planet on a collision course with Earth.

10.name: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
10.description: A simple, small town man inherits a massive fortune, making him the target for scammers and publicity-seekers. Overwhelmed by the turn his life has taken, and awoken to another use for his new-found fortune, he makes a momentous decision.

11.name: Camille
11.description: A Parisian courtesan must choose between the young man who loves her and the callous baron who wants her, even as her own health begins to fail.

12.name: Swing Time
12.description: A performer and gambler travels to New York City to raise the $25,000 he needs to marry his fiancée, only to become entangled with a beautiful aspiring dancer.

13.name: Dodsworth
13.description: A retired auto manufacturer and his wife take a long-planned European vacation only to find that they want very different things from life.

14.name: Secret Agent
14.description: After three British Agents are assigned to assassinate a mysterious German spy during World War I, two of them become ambivalent when their duty to the mission conflicts with their consciences.

15.name: Tell Your Children
15.description: Cautionary tale features a fictionalized take on the use of marijuana. A trio of drug dealers lead innocent teenagers to become addicted to "reefer" cigarettes by holding wild parties with jazz music.

16.name: After the Thin Man
16.description: Nick investigates the case of a missing man and later a murder that is connected to Nora's family.

17.name: The Petrified Forest
17.description: A waitress, a hobo and a bank robber get mixed up at a lonely diner in the desert.

18.name: Fury
18.description: When a wrongly accused prisoner barely survives a lynch mob attack and is presumed dead, he vindictively decides to fake his death and frame the mob for his supposed murder.

19.name: San Francisco
19.description: A Barbary Coast saloonkeeper and a Nob Hill impresario are rivals for the affections of a beautiful singer, both personally and professionally in 1906 San Francisco.

20.name: The Great Ziegfeld
20.description: The ups and downs of Florenz Ziegfeld Jr., famed producer of extravagant stage revues, are portrayed.

21.name: Little Lord Fauntleroy
21.description: An American boy turns out to be the long-lost heir of a British fortune. He is sent to live with the cold and unsentimental lord who oversees the trust.

22.name: The Devil-Doll
22.description: An escaped convict uses miniaturized humans to wreak vengeance on those that framed him.

23.name: Romeo and Juliet
23.description: Young love is poisoned by a generations long feud between two noble families.

24.name: Pigskin Parade
24.description: Married coaches Slug and Bessie find hillbilly football tosser Amos and the team gets invited to the Yale Bowl.

25.name: Born to Dance
25.description: Sailor Ted meets at the Lonely Hearts Club of his friend Gunny's wife, Jenny, a girl, Nora Paige, and falls in love. Nora wants to become a dancer on Broadway. Ted rescues the Pekinese of ...                See full summary »

26.name: The Devil Is a Sissy
26.description: A well-bred young English lad living in lower Manhattan tries to gain acceptance from his not-so-well-bred peers at school.

27.name: Show Boat
27.description: Despite her mother's objections, the naive young daughter of a show boat captain is thrust into the limelight as the company's new leading lady.

28.name: The Walking Dead
28.description: After hapless pianist and ex-con John Elman is framed for murder, he is resurrected by a scientist after his execution.

29.name: The Gorgeous Hussy
29.description: President Andrew Jackson's friendship with an innkeeper's daughter spells trouble for them both.

30.name: These Three
30.description: Two school teachers and the man they both love face ruin when a malicious student cooks up a lie.

31.name: Tarzan Escapes
31.description: An expedition seeking to bring Jane back to civilization, and Tarzan into captivity, gets more than it's bargained for.

32.name: Mummy's Boys
32.description: Two ditch diggers from New York join an archeological expedition to Egypt in hopes of striking it rich, unaware of the supposed curse.

33.name: The Trail of the Lonesome Pine
33.description: A feud, the origins of which can barely be remembered, has been boiling for decades between two sheltered mountain families, the Tollivers and the Falins. With plans to build a railroad ...                See full summary »

34.name: Libeled Lady
34.description: A newspaper man, his ignored fiancée, and his former employee, a down on his luck reporter, hatch an elaborate scheme to turn a false news story into the truth in order to prevent a high-society woman from suing for libel.

35.name: The Invisible Ray
35.description: A scientist becomes murderous after discovering, and being exposed to the radiation of, a powerful new element called Radium X.

36.name: Call of the Prairie
36.description: Hoppy has to bust up a gang of outlaws with the help of his sidekicks Shanghai and Johnny. As usual, he walks through the fusillade unscathed.

37.name: Come and Get It
37.description: An ambitious lumberjack abandons his saloon girl lover so that he can marry into wealth, but years later becomes infatuated with the woman's daughter.

38.name: Winds of the Wasteland
38.description: The arrival of the telegraph put Pony Express riders like John Blair and his pal Smoky out of work. A race will decide whether they or stageline owner Drake get the government mail contract.

39.name: Rembrandt
39.description: This character study joins the painter at the height of his fame in 1642, when his adored wife suddenly dies and his work takes a dark, sardonic turn that offends his patrons. By 1656, he ...                See full summary »

40.name: The Garden of Allah
40.description: The star-crossed desert romance of a cloistered woman and a renegade monk.

41.name: The Bohemian Girl
41.description: A band of Gypsies are camped outside the walls of Count Arnheim's palace. Oliver's wife kidnaps the Count's daughter Arline, then leaves the child and runs off with her lover, Devilshoof. ...                See full summary »

42.name: Mary of Scotland
42.description: The recently widowed Mary Stuart returns to Scotland to reclaim her throne but is opposed by her half-brother and her own Scottish lords.

43.name: Lloyds of London
43.description: Blake is in love with an aristocratic woman whose husband seriously injures him. Blake's friendship with Lord Nelson provides the basis for Blake's part in the growth of Lloyd's insurance ...                See full summary »

44.name: The Charge of the Light Brigade
44.description: A major countermands orders and attacks to avenge a previous massacre of men, women, and children.

45.name: Wife vs. Secretary
45.description: The wife of a publishing executive mistakenly believes that her husband's relationship with his attractive secretary is more than professional.

46.name: Trail Dust
46.description: Hoppy, Johnny and Windy are fighting a malicious gang trying to stop a cattle drive from reaching a drought-stricken North.

47.name: Desire
47.description: An automotive engineer bound for a holiday in Spain meets a sultry jewel thief.

48.name: Intermezzo
48.description: The world famous violinist Holger Brandt comes back to his family after a tour. He and his wife have been married for many years, but their love has gone. Their young daughter gets a new ...                See full summary »

49.name: The Story of Louis Pasteur
49.description: The biography of the pioneering French microbiologist who helped revolutionize agriculture and medicine.

50.name: Our Relations
50.description: Two pairs of long-lost twin brothers experience high jinks involving a valuable ring, cases of mistaken identity, and gangsters.
